                         SecurityException

      • findByCriteria

        public long[] findByCriteria(java.lang.String[] criteria)
        Find all records that match the specified criteria using a sequential search
        Specified by:
        findByCriteria in interface DBAccess
        Parameters:
        criteria - - The target criteria to look for. criteria array contains the same number of fields as in the database record. A null value in criteria[n] matches any value of the correspondent field n-th. A non-null value in criteria[n] matches any field value that begins with criteria[n]. (For example, "Fred" matches "Fred" or "Freddy".)
        Returns:
        an array of record numbers that match the specified criteria. Null if nothing found or empty array if criteria is invalid

      • createRecord

        public long createRecord(java.lang.String[] data)
                  throws DuplicateKeyException

        Creates a new record in the database (possibly reusing a deleted entry).
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the record number of the new record after insert the given data.
        Throws:

      • unlock

        public void unlock(long recNo,
          long cookie)
            throws SecurityException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie
        Specified by:
        unlock in interface DBAccess
        Parameters:
        recNo - - The record number to be unlocked.
        lockCookie - - The cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException. Unlocks the record.
        recNo - Record to be unlocked. -1 implies unlock the database.
        lockCookie - The record (or the database) should have been locked using this key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - Thrown if the lockCookie does not match the key with which the record was locked.
        SecurityException

      • lockRecord

        public long lockRecord(long recNo)
                throws RecordNotFoundException
        Implement DBAccess interface function. Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU until the record is unlocked.
        Specified by:
        lockRecord in interface DBAccess
        Parameters:
        recNo - - The record number to be locked.
        Returns:
        the lock identification or cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted.
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException

      • main2

        public static void main2(java.lang.String[] args)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This main method is just to test the locking functionality. It creates 4 threads that randomly request and release locks.

        args -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
